body.p: How can you ensure that requirements can be followed from its origins, through its use, and post-deployment?

feedback.p: Correct: This is traceability. A good requirement should be traceable and it ensures that you can quickly evaluate changes.
Incorrect. A complete requirement takes project constraints into account.
Incorrect: A verifiable requirement ensures that testers can verify that it was implemented correctly.

body.p: A traceable requirement is important because:

multiple_choice.choice: It will describe the life of a requirement from its development to its specification and deployment.
It confirms stakeholder analysis and indicates levels of power to determine which stakeholders are needed for prioritization.
It confirms the information gathered when a business analyst elicited requirements from stakeholders.

feedback.p: Correct. This is beneficial for keeping track of changes to a requirement throughout the requirements gathering and solution development processes.
Incorrect. Traceability does not indicate the priority of requirements. Priority of requirements is set by the data science and business team with project constraints and business objectives in mind.
Incorrect. A testable requirement will confirm the information gathered from stakeholders.
